member.name: T:RAMSPDToolkit.I2CSMBus.Interop.AMD.AtiAdl._ADL2_Main_Control_Create
member.summary:
Function to initialize the ADL2 interface and to obtain client's context handle.
Clients can use ADL2 versions of ADL APIs to assure that there is no interference with other ADL clients that are running in the same process. Such clients have to call ADL2_Main_Control_Create first to obtain ADL_CONTEXT_HANDLE instance that has to be passed to each subsequent ADL2 call and finally destroyed using . ADL initialized using ADL2_Main_Control_Create will not enforce serialization of ADL API executions by multiple threads. Multiple threads will be allowed to enter to ADL at the same time. Note that ADL library is not guaranteed to be thread-safe. Client that calls ADL2_Main_Control_Create have to provide its own mechanism for ADL calls serialization.
member.param: The memory allocation function for memory buffer allocation. This must be provided by the user. ADL internally uses this callback to allocate memory for the output parameters returned to the user and user is responsible to free the memory once used for these parameters. ADL internal takes care of allocating and de allocating the memory for its local variables.

Specify a value of 0 to retrieve adapter information for all adapters that have ever been present in the system. Specify a value of 1 to retrieve adapter information only for adapters that are physically present and enabled in the system.
ADL_CONTEXT_HANDLE instance that has to be passed to each subsequent ADL2 call and finally destroyed using ADL2_Main_Control_Destroy.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is . Otherwise the return value is an ADL error code.

member.name: T:RAMSPDToolkit.I2CSMBus.Interop.AMD.AtiAdl._ADL2_Main_Control_Destroy
member.summary:
Destroy client's ADL context.
Clients can use ADL2 versions of ADL APIs to assure that there is no interference with other ADL clients that are running in the same process and to assure that ADL APIs are thread-safe. Such clients have to call first to obtain ADL_CONTEXT_HANDLE instance that has to be passed to each subsequent ADL2 call and finally destroyed using ADL2_Main_Control_Destroy.
member.param: ADL_CONTEXT_HANDLE instance to destroy.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is . Otherwise the return value is an ADL error code.

member.name: T:RAMSPDToolkit.I2CSMBus.Interop.AMD.AtiAdl._ADL2_Adapter_Primary_Get
member.summary:
Function to retrieve the primary display adapter index.
This function retrieves the adapter index for the primary display adapter.
member.param: Client's ADL context handle ADL_CONTEXT_HANDLE obtained from .
The pointer to the ADL index handle of the primary adapter.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is . Otherwise the return value is an ADL error code.

member.name: T:RAMSPDToolkit.I2CSMBus.Interop.AMD.AtiAdl._ADL2_Display_WriteAndReadI2C
member.summary:
Function to write and read I2C.
This function writes and reads I2C.
member.param: Client's ADL context handle ADL_CONTEXT_HANDLE obtained from .
The ADL index handle of the desired adapter.
A pointer to the structure.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is . Otherwise the return value is an ADL error code.

member.name: T:RAMSPDToolkit.I2CSMBus.Interop.AMD.AtiAdl._ADL2_Adapter_AdapterInfoX4_Get
member.summary:
ADL local interface. Retrieves extended adapter information for given adapter or all OS-known adapters.
This function retrieves information for passed adapter or if pass -1, information of all OS-known adapters in the system. OS-known adapters can include adapters that are physically present in the system (logical adapters) as well as ones that are no longer present in the system but are still recognized by the OS.
member.param: Client's ADL context handle ADL_CONTEXT_HANDLE obtained from .
The ADL index handle of the desired adapter or -1 if all adapters are desired.
Number of items in the lppAdapterInfo array. Can pass NULL pointer if passing an adapter index (in which case only one AdapterInfo is returned).
A pointer to the pointer of array. Initialize to NULL before calling this API. ADL will allocate the necessary memory, using the user provided callback function.
member.returns: If the function valid, the return value is 1. Otherwise it is 0.

member.name: P:RAMSPDToolkit.I2CSMBus.SMBusInterface.HasSPDWriteProtection
member.summary:
This property is to determine if SPD Write Protection is enabled.
If it is enabled, writing to SPD is not possible.
Currently it is known to be enabled on newer Intel CPU systems.
Allowing SPD writes can usually be changed in BIOS settings by the PCs user.

member.name: M:RAMSPDToolkit.I2CSMBus.SMBusInterface.i2c_smbus_write_quick(System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Does a quick write with given value at provided address.
member.param: Address to do a quick write on.
Value to write.
member.returns: When the return value is negative, it is an error code. If positive, the value returned by SMBus call.

member.name: T:RAMSPDToolkit.SPD.DDR4Accessor
member.summary:
Accessor for DDR4 SPD.
This works for Windows and Linux.
member.remarks: Please refer to JEDEC Standard for EE1004 and TSE2004av for property definitions.

member.name: P:RAMSPDToolkit.SPD.DDR4Accessor.ThermalSensorCapabilitiesRegister
member.summary: The TS Capabilities Register indicates the supported features of the temperature sensor portion of the TSE2004av.

member.name: P:RAMSPDToolkit.SPD.DDR4Accessor.ThermalSensorConfigurationRegister
member.summary: The TS Configuration Register holds the control and status bits of the EVENT_n pin as well as general hysteresis on all limits.

member.name: P:RAMSPDToolkit.SPD.DDR4Accessor.ThermalSensorCriticalLimit
member.summary:
Thermal sensor critical limit.
The standard does not specify if this is a critical low or high limit, so we should assume it is both.

member.name: P:RAMSPDToolkit.SPD.DDR4Accessor.ThermalSensorManufacturerID
member.summary: The Manufacturer ID Register holds the PCI SIG number assigned to the specific manufacturer.

member.name: P:RAMSPDToolkit.SPD.DDR4Accessor.ThermalSensorDeviceID
member.summary:
The upper byte of the Device ID / Revision Register must be 0x22 for the TSE2004av.
The lower byte holds the revision value which is vendor-specific.

member.name: T:RAMSPDToolkit.SPD.Mappings.ManufacturerMapping
member.summary:
Mapping for manufacturers according to JEDEC standard.
Please note that this starts at Bank 1, not Bank 0.
member.remarks: Biggest part of this class is autogenerated via a python script.

member.name: F:RAMSPDToolkit.SPD.Mappings.ManufacturerMapping.ManufacturerBanks
member.summary:
Stores manufacturer banks beginning at Bank 1.
Note: if you have, for example, number of continuation codes zero (0) you need to access Bank 1.

This becomes a great functionality if having a DDR5 system with enabled.
